comments:
When we let the client side scenario create a client project (e.g. Web), an
AssertionFailedException occurs in some Facet management code due to a null progress monitor being passed into the command. I debugged this with Rupam and it turns out that the CreateModuleCommand used by PreClientAssembleCommand needs a non-null IProgressMonitor passed in to it. Also, you could do the same with the AssociateModuleWithEARCommand.

I'll downgrade this bugzilla later if I find that using a precreated project solves the problem.

Without the stack trace showing exactly which code is expecting a non-null progress monitor, its hard to do anything about this bug. I checked all of the api on the FacetedProject that takes progress monitors and it does handle nulls. It's possible that one of the delegates expects a non-null progress monitors or even something outside the framework.

Chris,
The fix would be as you say. We just need to pass in a non-null monitor to CreateModuleCommand and it might also be good to add code inside the CreateModuleCommand to check for a null monitor and new up a NullProgressMonitor if needed. 

Chris, Konstantin:
Yen has the stack trace but if I recall, the problem was with the call to ProjectFacetsManager.create(..) and the problems occurred at line 311 of ProjectFacetsMangagerImpl:

    project.create( desc, new SubProgressMonitor( monitor, 1 ) );

If you dig down into the constuctor for SubProgressMonitor, it does an assertNotNull(monitor).

Created an attachment (id=31378)
Patch fix to this bug.

Rupam,
thanks for the stack trace. I'm attaching a patch for Yen to try and for you to review.

Kosta,
that's good news that null progress monitors are allowed by the Facets API. It appears Rupam has found a garden variety, isolated bug.

On a much, much less serious note, the JavaDoc for a couple of the Facet methods I happened to look at did not declare that a null progress monitor was allowed. This is obviously not a technical issue, and may also have been a couple of isolated cases since I only peeked at a couple of methods, but I would recommend updating your JavaDoc by stealing the following line commonly found across the Eclipse platform and in Server tools: "monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting and cancellation are not desired".

Thanks - CB.
Go ahead and assign this bug to me when you are done with the patch...

Konstantin,
I opened a new one: bug 119893
Committed and released under tag v20051208_1145. Resolving (since Kosta, you've got a new bug to play with instead!).

Here's the stack trace:
